68.Project_Description: Strengthening & Scaling up of rehabilitation of degraded lands and enhancement of livelihoods in Lake Ziway catchment
68.Description: The goal of the project is to contribute to livelihood improvement and the establishment of financially viable governance structures for sustainable land & water management in the Ziway-Shala Basin. Reforestation of severely degraded grasslands in the upper watershed areas. Trees from a central nursery and local authority nurseries.

69.Description: The overall objective of the CASSAVA project is to increase food and nutrition security, employment and income among 28,000 smallholder farming households (at least 60% women).

86.Project_Description: Striking a Balance: Developing a Green Economy around Lake Bunyonyi
86.Description: Enhanced capacity of Kabale and Rubanda District local governments to contribute delivery of more inclusive and sustainable socio-economic development processes for their constituents.The project uses the Functional Landscape Approach to protect wetlands and create economic opportunities for wetland users. Trees planted as part of the catchment protection, wetland protection and income generation interventions.

87.Project_Description: Protecting and Restoring the Environment and Supporting the Emergence of a Resilient and Vibrant Economy in Kafue (PRESERVE)
87.Description: Preserve Kafue is a three-year project to improve the resilience, food, income and nutrition security of 3,000 households in the Monze, Namwala and Mazabuka districts of Zambia. The project will use the Functional Landscape Approach (FLA) to promote the sustainable use of natural resources for diversified livelihoods and increased incomes, whilst protecting and restoring essential eco-systems within the Kafue Sub-basin.

90.Implementing_Partners: National Drought Management Agency; Ministry of Agriculture; Livestock and fisheries; KALRO; Sustainable Agriculture Information Initiative; Farming Systems Kenya
90.Description: The project recently started, field activities delayed due to Covid-19.The primary aim of the project is to manage the rangelands in the project sub counties. Rangeland management includes the harvesting and eradication of Prosopis juliflora that has encroached on rangelands. The Prosopis will be sold to the breweries for biomass power production. Area to be cleared will be surveyedFMNR will be promoted on rangeland cleared of prosopis. The project will also include homestead fruit tree production.

93.Project_Description: Women's Economic Empowerment Through Entrepreneurship in the Cashew Value Chain (DEFI)
93.Description: A newly-launched cashew project that will provide a valuable source of income for 2,800 women farmers in West Africa. The project will also create enterprises around other income-generating activities, such as beekeeping and market gardening.

96.Description: A land use planning project implemented by CARE Tanzania in collaboration with WWF to improve livelihoods and promote the sustainable management of natural resources.

97.Description: In a world of inequality, natural resource degradation, and a changing climate, the CARE-WWF Alliance is developing solutions that help create livelihoods and opportunities forÂ vulnerable womenÂ and men to lift themselves out of poverty while managing natural resources, protecting wildlife, and conserving their habitats.

103.Project_Description: HIMA - Piloting REDD+ in Zanzibar Through Community Forest Management
103.Description: The HIMA Project emphasises the importance of community-based natural resource management, reducing carbon dioxide emissions from land-use activities, improving community livelihoods, especially those of women, and contributing to biodiversity conservation by protecting standing forests and assisting in the natural regeneration of forests as a means of improving wildlife habitat in the project area.

111.Project_Description: EPWS - Equitable Payment for Watersehd Services
111.Description: Catalysing stewardship of the management of the water catchment area by local communities and the beneficiaries of the Watershed Services (i.e. water users) for the Ruvu River in addressing land use change which is a major water problem

112.Description: The Community Based Eco-DRR project,  aims to strengthen the resilience of communities and ecosystems vulnerable to climate-induced hazards.

113.Project_Description: The Sundarbans  Development and Alternative Resources Integration (SUNDARI)
113.Description: The SUNDARI aimed to improve food security of extremely poor households dependant on the Sundarbans Reserve Forests. The program was aimed at supporting women through several proven strategies to reduce household dependency on Sundarbans Reserve Forests.

115.Project_Description: Paribartan (Increasing Resilience and Reducing Risk of Coastal Communities to Climate Change and Natural Hazards in the Bay of Bengal)
115.Description: The overall objective of the Paribartan project is to build resilience of coastal communities along the Bay of Bengal by increasing their ability, along with that of authorities and organizations, to prepare for and adapt to the impacts of hazards and climate change.

116.Project_Description: Paribartan (Increasing Resilience and Reducing Risk of Coastal Communities to Climate Change and Natural Hazards in the Bay of Bengal)

121.Project_Description: Improving Sustainable Productivity in Farming Systems and Enhanced Livelihoods through Adoption of Evergreen Agriculture in Eastern Africa
121.Description: The aim was to enhance food security for resource-poor rural people in Eastern Africa through research that underpins national programmes to scale up the use of trees within farming systems  and  scale out successes to relevant agro-ecological zones in Uganda.

122.Project_Description: Improving Sustainable Productivity in Farming Systems and Enhanced Livelihoods through Adoption of Evergreen Agriculture in Eastern Africa
122.Description: The aim was to enhance food security for resource-poor rural people in Eastern Africa through research that underpins national programmes to scale up the use of trees within farming systems  and  scale out successes to relevant agro-ecological zones in Uganda.

123.Project_Description: Improving Sustainable Productivity in Farming Systems and Enhanced Livelihoods through Adoption of Evergreen Agriculture in Eastern Africa
123.Description: The aim was to enhance food security for resource-poor rural people in Eastern Africa through research that underpins national programmes to scale up the use of trees within farming systems  and  scale out successes to relevant agro-ecological zones in Uganda.

124.Project_Description: Developing value chain innovation platforms to improve food security in East and Southern Africa (VIP4FS)
124.Description: The VIP4FS project centers on: what makes value-chain Innovation Platforms(IPs), IPs that incorporate value chain development strategies, are successful in terms of institutional, technological, market and policy factors that determine IP performance and how the establishment of IPs can be most cost-effectively called up across a range of contexts.

125.Project_Description: Developing value chain innovation platforms to improve food security in East and Southern Africa (VIP4FS)
125.Description: The VIP4FS project centers on: what makes value-chain Innovation Platforms(IPs), IPs that incorporate value chain development strategies, are successful in terms of institutional, technological, market and policy factors that determine IP performance and how the establishment of IPs can be most cost-effectively called up across a range of contexts.

126.Project_Description: Food trees for diversified diets, improved nutrition, and better livelihoods for smallholders in East Africa
126.Implementing_Partners: Nakaseke, Nakasongola Local governments, Bioversity International, NARO
126.Description: The overall goal of the Food Tree Project is to harness the role and contribution of climate-smart agroforestry and food trees for improving nutrition directly through increased availability and consumption of nutrient-rich foods and indirectly through the diversification of livelihood opportunities for smallholder farmers to attain long-term, inter-generational benefits for communities.

127.Project_Description: Food trees for diversified diets, improved nutrition, and better livelihoods for smallholders in East Africa
127.Implementing_Partners: Nakaseke, Nakasongola Local governments, Bioversity International, NARO
127.Description: The overall goal of the Food Tree Project is to harness the role and contribution of climate-smart agroforestry and food trees for improving nutrition directly through increased availability and consumption of nutrient-rich foods and indirectly through the diversification of livelihood opportunities for smallholder farmers to attain long-term, inter-generational benefits for communities.

128.Project_Description: Sustainable Use of Natural Resources and Energy in the Refugee Context in Uganda
128.Description: Piloting an integrated and holistic innovative approach to natural resource management (water, trees/biomass, energy) to sustainably improve access to water, energy and other ecosystem  goods and services and create more climate resilient landscapes    for refugees and host communities.

129.Implementing_Partners: Aruar district government, Gulu Agricultural Development Company, FUZU, CTEN, Innovation Village, Village Enterprise
129.Description: This project covers an initial expansion of the achievements of the Demonstrating a Market System Approach in Bidibidi and Palorinya Settlements (ReHope project) funded by DFID from July 2017-June 2018, which found that MSD is a viable approach to refugee response with a critical mass of early adopter refugee and host community farmers, agrodealers, input and output agents and private sector partners looking to expand agricultural production, support services and buying in West Nile in and around refugee hosting districts.

130.Project_Description: Developing integrated options and accelerating scaling up of agroforestry for improved food security and resilient livelihoods in Eastern Africa
130.Implementing_Partners: NaFORRI, Makerere University,World Vision, METGE, ANAFE
130.Description: The project aims to improve food security and smallholder livelihoods through the widespread adoption of appropriate locally adapted agroforestry practices in key agricultural landscapes in Eastern Africa.

131.Project_Description: Developing integrated options and accelerating scaling up of agroforestry for improved food security and resilient livelihoods in Eastern Africa
131.Implementing_Partners: NaFORRI, Makerere University,World Vision, METGE, ANAFE
131.Description: The project aims to improve food security and smallholder livelihoods through the widespread adoption of appropriate locally adapted agroforestry practices in key agricultural landscapes in Eastern Africa.

132.Description: Plant With Purpose's programs equip farming families around the world to increase farm yields, heal damaged ecosystems, improve nutrition, and increase household savings and opportunities. This integrated approach solves two major issues facing the world today: environmental degradation and rural poverty.

156.Project_Description: REGRADE (Resilience, Graduation and Evidence): To build livelihood security and improve nutrition outcomes among the extreme poor
156.Description: REGRADE programme combines REsilience Programming with the GRADuation model and Evidence building that targets communities living in 20 community micro watersheds found in seven woredas (three in South Wollo, Amhara Region and four in Wolaita, SNNP Region) of Ethiopia with a package of complimentary interventions over five year period (from Jan 1, 2017 - Dec 31, 2021). It aims to build sustainable livelihoods and graduate people from extreme poverty, and improve nutrition outcomes. The package of complementary interventions targets the extreme poor and includes land reclamation, watershed management and climate smart agriculture for livelihoods.
156.Practice: Land reclamation, watershed management, climate-smart agriculture

158.Project_Description: The Promoting Sustainable Partnerships for Empowered Resilience (PROSPER) programme
158.Description: This project aims to reduce the impact of climate shocks on poor and vulnerable households through asset transfers, improved agricultural production, natural resource management, and access to more diverse income streams.

159.Project_Description: The Promoting Sustainable Partnerships for Empowered Resilience (PROSPER) programme
159.Description: This project aims to reduce the impact of climate shocks on poor and vulnerable households through asset transfers, improved agricultural production, natural resource management, and access to more diverse income streams.

161.Description: This project aims to reduce the impact of climate shocks on poor and vulnerable households through asset transfers, improved agricultural production, natural resource management, and access to more diverse income streams.

162.Project_Description: The Promoting Sustainable Partnerships for Empowered Resilience (PROSPER) programme
162.Description: This project aims to reduce the impact of climate shocks on poor and vulnerable households through asset transfers, improved agricultural production, natural resource management, and access to more diverse income streams.

163.Implementing_Partners: RDF, VDO, LPP, ACTED, IRC, Doaba
163.Description: The programme is contributing towards increased capacity of the local communities and the government institutions to increase their resilience through better planning, preparedness response and resource allocation at the governmental and community levels. Funded by DFID and led by Concern as Consortium Lead (consortium members: ACTED, the International Rescue Committee/IRC, Welthungerhilfe/WHH and HelpAge), this programme is in its 2nd phase and is being implemented in 9 districts, of which Concern is directly working in 3 districts. The programme focuses to build the resilience of approx. 333,000 vulnerable persons through targeted assistance in the sectors of CBDRM, livelihoods, WASH and Shelter infrastructure and building the capacity of disaster management institutions. The phase-II of the programme is ongoing which is ending on 29 September 2020.

164.Implementing_Partners: RDF, VDO, LPP, ACTED, IRC, Doaba

170.Description: An integrated early recovery and building resilience intervention for the drought-affected communities. It aims to enable the poor and most vulnerable communities as well as government institutions at the village, union council, and district level, to strengthen community and government's local Disaster Risk Management (DRM) institutions. The program is supporting the risk management policy and practice, agriculture and food security, economic recovery and market system and WASH needs of the drought affected communities to improve their coping strategies to withstand and respond to the ongoing drought and other future hazards and shocks.

171.Description: By using the farmer managed natural regeneration (FMNR) method and re-introducing rainwater harvesting practices, we aim to restore soils, re-green the area and improve the productivity of the land in central Tanzania. With our project we will reach out to 300 villages in the Dodoma region, and thereby helping 180,000 farmers.

172.Description: By digging more than 99,600 semi-circular bunds, Justdiggit has brought back vegetation to this once degraded area, making it useful again for the local community. Furthermore, we make an impact by educating and assisting women groups on starting grass seed banks.

173.Implementing_Partners: Amboseli Ecosystem Trust, African Conservation Centre, Amboseli Conservation Program, Kenya Wildlife Service
173.Description: Justdiggit is bringing back hundreds of hectares of forest cover to Amboseli National Park, which holds one of the largest elephant populations in Kenya. We mainly do this by digging soil bunds and promoting sustainable grazing management. Furthermore, we make an impact by educating and assisting women groups on starting grass seed banks.

174.Project_Description: Building Resilience and Adaptation to Climate Extremes and Disasters in the Sub-Prefecture of Goz Beida, Kimiti Department in Sila Region.
174.Description: An Integrated Programme on reinforcing Community Resilience (2017-2021) which is through a multi-sectoral Programme. The Programme aims at generating  sustained improvements in livelihoods security of extremely poor and marginalized people in the Sila region of eastern Chad that can withstand frequent shocks (especially drought and floods) and the predicted changes in climate over the next 20 years.  Main outcomes include improving household resilience to extreme weather events, increasing participation of women in decision-making and control of resources and facilitating access for communities to relevant early warning information and use it to prevent, prepare for and respond to hazards, particularly drought.

175.Project_Description: Wadata Al’umma: Enhancing the Wellbeing of the Extreme Poor in Tahoua
175.Description: As a result of the interconnected nature of the underlying causes of chronic poverty and vulnerability in Niger, Concern has adopted an integrated context-based programme approach to ensure that projects implemented are able to address the multidimensional nature of extreme poverty and tackle the specific barriers that confront the extreme poor in Tahoua Region. Wadata Al’umma will focus on: (i) Reducing biases and inequalities faced by the extreme poor and vulnerable, particularly women and girls; (ii) Improving access to quality health, nutrition, education and WASH services; and (iii) Enhancing livelihood systems, natural resource management and environmental protection, all of which are necessary in building the resilience of the most vulnerable to not only combat longer-term poverty but also to cope with the cyclical annual hunger gap season. Wadata Al’umma programme activities focus on the household and village level. Activities at the household level will ensure that households and individuals that make up that community are able to cope with shocks and stresses.

176.Project_Description: Realigning Agriculture Into Nutrition to Enhance the Wellbeing of the Extreme Poor in Tahoua (RAIN)
176.Description: Rain is an integrated development programme designed to tackle the significant barriers that confront the extreme poor in the Tahoua Region of Niger. The programme will focus on improving food and nutrition security and enhancing the livelihoods of the most vulnerable households in Tahoua by: (i) increasing food production and diversity of nutrient-rich fruit and vegetables; (ii) promoting key health practices for improved maternal and child nutrition; (iii) improving access to reliable and safe water sources and improved sanitation; (iv) reducing inequalities experienced by the extreme poor and vulnerable, particularly women and girls, with a view to increasing social cohesion and empowering marginalised community members to actively participate in building a sustainable future for their communities; (v) strengthening the capacity of local structures to identify issues and solutions within the community. The abovementioned activities are linked to Concern's Climate Smart Agriculture (CSA) approach which aims to simultaneously enhance livelihood systems, natural resource management and environmental protection, all of which are necessary in building the resilience of the most vulnerable to combat long-term malnutrition.

177.Project_Description: Integrated Project to Support the Resilience of Vulnerable Refugee, Displaced, Returnee and Host Populations in the Diffa Region
177.Description: Since 2017, the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), together with partner organizations, has been implementing an urbanization project in six communes in the Diffa region (Lake Chad). This project, entitled Kallo Tchidanio, financed by the European Union Trust Fund, aims to develop sustainable housing solutions for 4,000 households affected by displacement (returnees, refugees, IDPs or vulnerable host households) through the allotment of an urbanized site in each commune by 2020. In order to offer economic development opportunities to the target populations and to provide them with sustainable access to basic services, Concern Worldwide in consortium with ACTED, WeltHungerHilfe and Impact Initiatives is implementing the "Projet intégré d'appui à la résilience des populations vulnérables réfugiées, déplacées, retournées et hôtes de la région de Diffa »" funded by the European Union. This three-year project (2019-2021) is complementary to UNHCR's actions in the 6 urbanized sites in the communes of Mainé Soroa, Chetimari, Diffa, Gueskérou, Kablewa and N'Guigmi.

180.Project_Description: Pastoralist Resilience Improved through Market Expansion (PRIME)
180.Implementing_Partners: CARE, Mercy Corps (lead), Aged and Children Pastoralists Association (ACPA), Action for Integrated Sustainable Development (AISDA), CARE, Ethiopian Center for Disability and Development (ECDD), Haramaya University, Horn of Africa Voluntary Youth Committee (Havoyoco), Kimetrica, SOS Sahel.
180.Description: The program overall goal is increasing Household Incomes and Enhancing Resilience to Climate Change through Market Linkages. The program focused on livestock productivity and competitiveness;  Natural Resource Management; alternative livelihoods for households transitioning out of pastoralism; innovation, learning and knowledge management; and Nutritional support to targeted households
180.Practice: Prosopis clearing, bush control, area closure, dry season reserve, and soil and water conservation works

181.Project_Description: Pastoralist Resilience Improved through Market Expansion (PRIME)
181.Implementing_Partners: CARE, Mercy Corps (lead), Aged and Children Pastoralists Association (ACPA), Action for Integrated Sustainable Development (AISDA), CARE, Ethiopian Center for Disability and Development (ECDD), Haramaya University, Horn of Africa Voluntary Youth Committee (Havoyoco), Kimetrica, SOS Sahel.

183.Project_Description: Promoting Resilient Livelihoods in Borana (RESET II)
183.Implementing_Partners: CARE Ethiopia, Oromo Self Help Organization (OSHO) and Action Against Hunger (AAH)
183.Description: With the overall aim of enhancing the resilience of over 100,000 PSNP and other vulnerable communities, of which over 70,000 are women covering 21,000 households in total, the project results consists of five outcomes i.e. improved access and coverage of health and nutrition, diversified and increased livelihood opportunities and incomes, improved Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) capacity, enhanced research and knowledge management systems and reduced barriers to women empowerment.
183.Practice: Range land rehabilitation, Reforestation and transplanting

184.Project_Description: Promoting Resilient Livelihoods in Borana (RESET II)
184.Implementing_Partners: CARE Ethiopia, Oromo Self Help Organization (OSHO) and Action Against Hunger (AAH)

184.Practice: Range land rehabilitation, Reforestation and transplanting

185.Project_Description: Promoting Resilient Livelihoods in Borana (RESET II)
185.Implementing_Partners: CARE Ethiopia, Oromo Self Help Organization (OSHO) and Action Against Hunger (AAH)
185.Description: With the overall aim of enhancing the resilience of over 100,000 PSNP and other vulnerable communities, of which over 70,000 are women covering 21,000 households in total, the project results consists of five outcomes i.e. improved access and coverage of health and nutrition, diversified and increased livelihood opportunities and incomes, improved Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) capacity, enhanced research and knowledge management systems and reduced barriers to women empowerment.
185.Practice: Range land rehabilitation, Reforestation and transplanting

188.Project_Description: Strengthening PSNP Institutions and Resilience (SPIR)  - Development Food Security Activity (DFSA)
188.Implementing_Partners: World Vision (Lead), CARE, Organization for Rehabilitation and Development in Amhara (ORDA), International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI), Hawassa University and Ambo University.
188.Description:
The goal of the project is to Strengthen PSNP4 Institutions and Resilience focusing on enhance livelihoods, increase resilience to shocks, and improve food security and nutrition for rural households vulnerable to food insecurity in Ethiopia.
Its 4 Purposes are: 
• Increased income, productive assets and equitable access to nutritious food for vulnerable women, men and youth
•  Improved nutritional status of children under two years of age, pregnant and lactating women, and adolescent girls
•  Increased women’s empowerment, youth empowerment and gender equity
•  Strengthened ability of women, men and communities to mitigate, adapt to and recover from human-caused and natural shocks and stressesâ€¢  Strengthened ability of women, men and communities to mitigate, adapt to and recover from human-caused and natural shocks and stresses

192.Project_Description: SWEEP - Water for Food Security, Womenâ€™s Empowerment and Environmental Protection in East and West Belesa Project
192.Description: SWEEP will improve water resources, empower vulnerable groups, and support community development in order to make lasting and sustainable improvements to the food security and resilience of chronically food insecure households.

194.Description:
The project Goal is to improve the resilience capacities of households, markets and governance institutions across the Somali, Oromia and Afar regions, collectively contributing to enhanced food security and inclusive economic growth for over 178,000  households.
The project Objectives includes: Improved Disaster Risk Management Systems and Capacity;  Diversified and Sustainable Economic Opportunities for People Transitioning out of Pastoralism (ToPs) particularly youth and women;  Intensified and Sustained Pastoral and Agro-Pastoral Production and Marketing;  Improved and Sustained Nutrition and Hygiene Practices; Crisis Modifier
